attributes.action: Referndum in England to Ring Fence English Tax Revenues
attributes.additional_details: Following Mr Salmond’s views regarding the validity of the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom being allowed to be involved in the decision to hold a referendum on the future of the Union and in the absence of an English Parliament to represent England’s interests, a referendum should be held in England to decide if the tax revenues derived from England should be ring fenced and no subsidy should be provided to Scotland or Wales.
